ideas.title: Remove duplicate Analytics nav item from sidebar
ideas.description: "Analytics" appears in both primaryNavigation (line 74-79, BarChart3 icon) and secondaryNavigation (line 83-89, PieChart icon), both pointing to APP_ROUTES.ANALYTICS. Users see two Analytics links in the sidebar separated by a divider.
ideas.rationale: Two different-looking items going to the same destination is a direct UX defect. Violates the principle of a single, unambiguous path to any destination.
ideas.current_state: Sidebar renders two Analytics entries with different icons, both routing to /app/analytics
ideas.proposed_change: Remove the Analytics entry from secondaryNavigation (lines 83-89). Keep the primary one at line 74-79.
ideas.user_benefit: Clear, unambiguous navigation — one link per destination

ideas.title: Show music CTA as primary action, not subscription form
ideas.description: ProfilePrimaryCTA (line 87-102) replaces the Listen/Spotify button with ArtistNotificationsCTA when notifications are enabled and the visitor hasn't subscribed. First-time visitors from Instagram bio expect music links, not a subscription form.
ideas.rationale: The primary value proposition of a link-in-bio music platform is connecting fans to music. Gating this behind a notification signup is a conversion barrier that works against the core product promise.
ideas.current_state: Notification subscribe form replaces music CTA by default for all unsubscribed visitors
ideas.proposed_change: Show the Listen/music CTA as the primary button. Place the subscribe form as a secondary element below it, or as an inline prompt after the user clicks listen.
ideas.user_benefit: Visitors immediately see what they came for — music streaming links

ideas.title: Reduce sidebar nav from 9 items to grouped sections
ideas.description: The sidebar presents 9 unique nav items (Profile, Contacts, Releases, Tour Dates, Audience, Analytics x2, Earnings, Chat) plus up to 10 recent chats simultaneously. No grouping or progressive disclosure beyond a thin divider.
ideas.rationale: Hick's Law: decision time increases logarithmically with choices. For a link-in-bio tool targeted at music creators, 9+ primary destinations is cognitive overload. Contacts vs Audience have overlapping mental models.
ideas.current_state: Flat list of 9 nav items with no semantic grouping, plus 10 recent chats
ideas.proposed_change: Group nav into 3 semantic sections with labels: Content (Profile, Releases, Tour Dates), People (Contacts, Audience), Insights (Analytics, Earnings). Cap recent chats at 3-5 visible with 'View all' link.
ideas.user_benefit: Faster navigation, reduced cognitive load, clearer information architecture

ideas.title: Prioritize Releases in mobile bottom nav over Contacts
ideas.description: Mobile bottom bar shows [Dashboard, Profile, Contacts, Audience]. Releases — a core feature for music creators — is hidden behind 'More'. The expanded More menu also duplicates all 4 primary items.
ideas.rationale: For a music creator tool, Releases should be more accessible than Contacts on mobile. The More menu showing duplicated primary items adds visual noise and wasted screen space.
ideas.current_state: mobilePrimaryNavigation: [Dashboard, Profile, Contacts, Audience]; expanded menu includes all primary items again
ideas.proposed_change: Change mobile primary to [Dashboard, Profile, Releases, More]. Remove duplicate primary items from expanded menu.
ideas.user_benefit: Core feature (Releases) is one tap away on mobile instead of buried in More menu

ideas.title: Add visible progress indicator to onboarding flow
ideas.description: The onboarding flow has 3 steps (Name, Handle, Done) but no visible progress indicator. The step indicator is in a sr-only div (AppleStyleOnboardingForm.tsx line 213-216), invisible to sighted users.
ideas.rationale: Progress indicators reduce abandonment by setting expectations. Users currently have no sense of how many steps remain.
ideas.current_state: Step indicator is screen-reader-only; sighted users see no progress
ideas.proposed_change: Add visible step dots or a minimal progress bar above the form content. 3 dots with active state highlighting.
ideas.user_benefit: Clear expectations about onboarding length, reduced abandonment

ideas.title: Auto-skip onboarding handle step when handle is pre-validated
ideas.description: Users enter a handle on the homepage ClaimHandleForm, get sent to /onboarding?handle=<handle>, then the onboarding handle step shows the same field pre-filled requiring re-validation. The handle is collected twice.
ideas.rationale: Redundant input steps add friction. If the handle was already validated on the homepage, re-presenting it wastes user time.
ideas.current_state: Handle entered and validated on homepage, then shown again pre-filled in onboarding step 1 for re-validation
ideas.proposed_change: When initialHandle is passed via query param and already validated, auto-advance past the handle step. Show a brief confirmation toast instead.
ideas.user_benefit: One fewer step in onboarding for homepage sign-ups

ideas.title: Let artists control their primary CTA priority
ideas.description: ProfilePrimaryCTA uses a fixed priority waterfall: tickets > shop > spotify > listen. If an artist has a Bandsintown link, visitors always see 'Find tickets' even if the artist primarily wants to drive streams.
ideas.rationale: Artists should control their own conversion funnel. The current hardcoded priority may not match artist intent and cannot be overridden.
ideas.current_state: Fixed priority waterfall: tickets > shop > spotify > listen, not configurable
ideas.proposed_change: Add a 'primary_cta' preference to creator_profiles that lets artists choose their primary action from the dashboard. Fall back to the current waterfall when unset.
ideas.user_benefit: Artists control what visitors see as the primary action on their profile

ideas.title: Delete dead DashboardLayoutClient and DashboardSidebar
ideas.description: Two complete layout systems exist: the active AuthShell/UnifiedSidebar system and the dead DashboardLayoutClient/DashboardSidebar (649 lines total). The legacy system is only imported by Storybook mocks and has divergent behavior.
ideas.rationale: Dead code adds maintenance burden and developer confusion. The two sidebars have conflicting behavior (UserButton placement, collapse mode), creating contradictory mental models for developers.
ideas.current_state: 649 lines of dead layout code that may be accidentally modified or referenced
ideas.proposed_change: Delete both files. Update Storybook mocks to reference the active UnifiedSidebar system.
ideas.user_benefit: Reduces developer confusion, smaller codebase, no risk of modifying wrong layout

ideas.title: Simplify UserButton dropdown — remove nested legal links
ideas.description: The user menu dropdown contains ~10 actions including a 'Learn more' submenu nesting Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, Cookie Policy, and Keyboard Shortcuts. Legal links in a user menu is unusual placement.
ideas.rationale: Legal links belong in the footer or settings page, not nested in a user dropdown. The submenu adds navigation depth and cognitive load to an already packed menu.
ideas.current_state: 10 actions with nested 'Learn more' submenu containing 4 items
ideas.proposed_change: Remove 'Learn more' submenu. Move legal links to Settings page footer. Keep only: Profile, Settings, Billing, Feedback, Sign Out (5 items).
ideas.user_benefit: Simpler, faster user menu with fewer choices and no nested menus

ideas.title: Replace auto-redirect with explicit link on existing account sign-up
ideas.description: When a user signs up with an existing email, SignUpForm (lines 72-86) briefly shows 'Account already exists' then auto-redirects to sign-in after 1.5 seconds. No cancel mechanism.
ideas.rationale: Auto-navigation without user consent feels jarring. The 1.5s delay is too fast for slow readers and too slow for power users.
ideas.current_state: Auto-redirect to sign-in after 1.5s timer with no cancel
ideas.proposed_change: Show a clear message with a prominent 'Sign in instead' button. Remove the auto-redirect timer. Let the user click when ready.
ideas.user_benefit: User stays in control of navigation

ideas.title: Add visual indicator for collapsed sidebar hover zone
ideas.description: When sidebar is collapsed on desktop, a floating overlay appears when hovering a 20px invisible trigger zone on the left edge. No visual cue hints at this interaction.
ideas.rationale: Discoverable-only-by-accident interactions violate the visibility of system status heuristic. Users may never discover this feature.
ideas.current_state: Invisible 20px trigger zone, no visual affordance when sidebar is collapsed
ideas.proposed_change: Add a subtle visual indicator (thin vertical bar, small chevron icon, or gentle glow) on the left edge when sidebar is collapsed.
ideas.user_benefit: Users discover the sidebar expansion feature without stumbling on it by accident

ideas.title: Show notification CTA errors inline instead of in tooltips
ideas.description: ArtistNotificationsCTA (lines 395-416) shows validation errors as a tiny red circle icon with a tooltip. On mobile, tooltip interactions are unreliable.
ideas.rationale: Error messages should be immediately visible. Tooltips on mobile require tap-to-show behavior which is inconsistent across devices and browsers.
ideas.current_state: Errors hidden behind a small icon + tooltip interaction
ideas.proposed_change: Display error messages as inline text below the input field, matching standard form validation patterns used elsewhere in the app.
ideas.user_benefit: Errors are immediately visible on all devices without extra interaction

ideas.title: Remove 'Delete not implemented' placeholder toasts
ideas.description: ContactSidebar (line 99) and ReleaseSidebar (line 114) show toast.info('Delete not implemented') when users click delete buttons.
ideas.rationale: Placeholder functionality in production undermines user trust. Users expect buttons to work.
ideas.current_state: Delete buttons show 'not implemented' info toast
ideas.proposed_change: Either implement the delete action or hide the delete button entirely until the feature is ready.
ideas.user_benefit: No broken-feeling interactions that erode trust

ideas.title: Consolidate three DSP button implementations into one
ideas.description: Three separate components render DSP buttons: DSPButtonGroup (with DOMPurify sanitization), ListenSection (with deep links), StaticListenInterface (without sanitization). Each has its own click handlers, loading states, and deep-link logic.
ideas.rationale: Inconsistent behavior between the same visual element across pages confuses both users and developers. DOMPurify adds 70KB for trusted internal SVGs.
ideas.current_state: Three DSP button components with divergent sanitization, loading states, and deep-link handling
ideas.proposed_change: Consolidate into a single configurable DSP button list component. Remove DOMPurify for trusted internal SVGs.
ideas.user_benefit: Consistent button behavior on every page, faster page load (-70KB)

ideas.title: Increase social link touch targets to 44px minimum
ideas.description: Social link icons use h-10 w-10 (40x40px), below the 44px minimum recommended by WCAG 2.5.8 and Apple Human Interface Guidelines.
ideas.rationale: Touch targets below 44px cause mis-taps on mobile, especially for users with motor impairments.
ideas.current_state: 40x40px touch targets for social icons on public profile
ideas.proposed_change: Increase to h-11 w-11 (44x44px) or add transparent padding to maintain visual size with larger tappable area.
ideas.user_benefit: Easier tapping on mobile, meets accessibility minimum

ideas.title: Remove premature 'preference saved' notice on DSP buttons
ideas.description: DSPButtonGroup (lines 58-62) shows 'Your preference will be saved for next time' by default before any selection is made.
ideas.rationale: Showing this before any action is confusing — the visitor hasn't expressed a preference yet. It adds visual clutter to the initial view.
ideas.current_state: Preference notice shown on first visit before any selection
ideas.proposed_change: Only show the notice after a selection is made, or remove it entirely and save silently.
ideas.user_benefit: Cleaner initial view with less confusing text

ideas.title: Add retry actions to error states in activity feed and DSP matches
ideas.description: DashboardActivityFeed (line 164) and DspMatchList (line 105) show plain text errors with no retry button. CreatorProfile (lines 29-34) uses raw CSS colors instead of ErrorBanner.
ideas.rationale: Errors without recovery actions are dead ends. Users must manually refresh the entire page to retry.
ideas.current_state: Plain text errors with no retry button
ideas.proposed_change: Replace with ErrorBanner component which includes retry actions and consistent design-token styling.
ideas.user_benefit: Users can recover from errors in-place without refreshing the page

ideas.title: Use client-side navigation from onboarding to dashboard
ideas.description: Onboarding completion (AppleStyleOnboardingForm.tsx line 144-146) uses globalThis.location.href for hard navigation, causing a full page reload after smooth step transitions.
ideas.rationale: Hard reloads are jarring after smooth client-side transitions and add unnecessary latency.
ideas.current_state: Full page reload via globalThis.location.href to reach dashboard
ideas.proposed_change: Use Next.js router.push() for client-side navigation to the dashboard.
ideas.user_benefit: Smooth transition from onboarding to dashboard, no jarring reload

ideas.title: Add timeout escape hatch for OAuth SSO callback
ideas.description: SSO callback pages show only a logo animation with no interactive elements. If OAuth stalls, users have no way to cancel or go back.
ideas.rationale: Users stuck on a loading screen with no escape are forced to use browser back, which may break the auth flow.
ideas.current_state: Logo animation only — no timeout, no escape link
ideas.proposed_change: After 10 seconds, show a 'Taking too long? Try again' link that routes back to the sign-in/sign-up page.
ideas.user_benefit: Recovery path when OAuth flow stalls

ideas.title: Add visual loading feedback to SettingsAppearanceSection
ideas.description: Theme mutation has isPending that disables buttons but shows no visual loading indicator. If mutation fails, user gets zero feedback.
ideas.rationale: Users need visual confirmation that an action is processing. Silent failures with no error handling leave users confused.
ideas.current_state: Buttons disabled with no spinner; no error handling or rollback
ideas.proposed_change: Add spinner during mutation. Show toast.error on failure. Add rollback for notifications toggle on server rejection.
ideas.user_benefit: Clear feedback on theme and notification preference changes
